direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods create responses related to channel binding but handle different outcomes (success vs. error).
Both methods create responses with similar structures involving attributes like XOR-MAPPED-ADDRESS.
Both methods involve creating responses that handle resource allocation and binding, with similar attribute handling.
Both methods create responses that are part of the TURN protocol and depend on similar underlying mechanisms for attribute handling.
Both methods create success responses in the TURN protocol, and the test cases for one can be adapted for the other.
